User Story: As a user I would like to browse state-level legislation so that I can stay informed about bills in my state legislature and take action on issues that affect me locally.
Success Criteria:
- User can select their state from a list or have it auto-detected from profile
- User can browse recent state bills
- User can view bill details including title, summary, status, sponsors
- User can filter bills by status, topic, or chamber
- User can take advocacy action on state bills (support/oppose)

User Story: As a user I would like to view my state legislators so that I can see who represents me at the state level and contact them about state issues.
Success Criteria:
- User can view list of state legislators for their state
- User can filter by chamber (Senate/House/Assembly)
- User can see legislator party, district, and contact info
- User can click through to individual legislator profiles

User Story: As a user I would like to view detailed information about my federal representatives so that I can understand their positions, voting record, and how to contact them.
Success Criteria:
- User can view representative biography and photo
- User can see party affiliation and district
- User can view committee memberships
- User can see contact information (office address, phone, website)
- User can view ideology/voting scores
- User can see recent voting record
- User can view sponsored and cosponsored legislation
- User can see campaign finance information
- User can view recent news articles about the representative

User Story: As a user I would like to browse all members of Congress from a specific state so that I can see the full delegation and compare representatives.
Success Criteria:
- User can select a state to view its congressional delegation
- User can see both Senators and House Representatives
- User can filter by chamber or party
- User can sort by name, district, or seniority
- Each member links to their full profile page

User Story: As a user I would like to browse legislation by policy issue category so that I can find bills related to topics I care about.
Success Criteria:
- User can browse predefined policy categories (Immigration, Climate, Healthcare, etc.)
- User can filter by jurisdiction (Federal, State, or specific state)
- User can see bills tagged with each policy category
- User can see bill count per category
- User can click through to individual bill pages

User Story: As a user I would like to see an overview page for each policy issue so that I can understand the current landscape and find relevant bills and campaigns.
Success Criteria:
- User sees issue title and description
- User sees featured/trending bills for this issue
- User sees active campaigns from organizations on this issue
- User can navigate to federal or state-specific bill lists
- User can set this as a policy interest from the page

User Story: As an organization user I would like to create a candidate comparison campaign so that our members can compare two candidates' positions and share their preference.
Success Criteria:
- Organization can create campaign with two candidates
- Organization can add candidate names and bios
- Organization can set campaign start and end dates
- Users can view candidate comparison side-by-side
- Users can select their preferred candidate
- Organization can view results showing preference breakdown
- Campaign tracks total responses and preference percentages

User Story: As an organization user I would like to create voter polls so that I can survey our members on policy questions and gather constituent opinions.
Success Criteria:
- Organization can create poll with custom question
- Organization can add multiple answer choices (minimum 2, maximum 6)
- Organization can optionally add image to poll
- Organization can set poll start and end dates
- Users can vote on poll (one vote per verified user)
- Organization can view poll results with vote counts and percentages
- Poll results can be displayed as chart visualization

User Story: As a user I would like to view organization campaigns so that I can see their position on legislation and add my voice to their advocacy efforts.
Success Criteria:
- User can view organization's campaign page
- User can see organization's position (Support/Oppose) and reasoning
- User can see the associated bill details
- User can take action (support/oppose) directly from campaign
- User can see how many others have taken action
- User can send advocacy message linked to campaign
- Campaign tracks engagement metrics for organization

User Story: As a logged-in user I would like to see a personalized For You page so that I can quickly find bills and campaigns relevant to my policy interests and location.
Success Criteria:
- User sees bills filtered by their policy interests
- User sees bills relevant to their congressional district
- User sees campaigns from organizations they follow
- User sees trending/featured content
- Content is sorted by relevance score based on user preferences
- User can adjust their interests to change recommendations
- Page requires login to view personalized content

User Story: As a user I would like to view the full details of a message I've sent so that I can review what I wrote and who received it.
Success Criteria:
- User can view full message content they sent
- User can see list of recipients (representatives)
- User can see the bill/issue the message was about
- User can see their stance (Support/Oppose)
- User can see date and time message was sent
- User can see delivery status for each recipient
- User can navigate back to message history
- Only the message author can view their own messages

User Story: As a user I would like to see recent news articles about my representatives so that I can stay informed about their activities and statements.
Success Criteria:
- Representative profile page shows recent news articles
- Articles show headline, source, date, and thumbnail
- User can click through to read full article on source site
- News feed shows 5-10 most recent articles
- News refreshes periodically to show current coverage

User Story: As a user I would like to browse all federal bills so that I can discover legislation and stay informed about what Congress is considering.
Success Criteria:
- User can view list of federal bills from current Congress
- User can filter by bill type (HR, S, HJRES, SJRES, etc.)
- User can filter by status (Introduced, Passed House, Passed Senate, Enacted)
- User can search bills by keyword or bill number
- User can sort by date introduced, last action, or popularity
- Each bill links to full bill detail page
- Pagination for browsing large lists

User Story: As a user I would like to view detailed information about a specific bill so that I can understand what it does and take informed action.
Success Criteria:
- User can view bill title, number, and congress session
- User can read bill summary (plain language explanation)
- User can see bill sponsors and cosponsors
- User can see current bill status and progress visualization
- User can see committee assignments
- User can see related actions and timeline
- User can see voting records if votes have occurred
- User can take action (Support/Oppose) on the bill
- User can send advocacy message about the bill
- User can see how many others have supported/opposed
